commText: de Kock and Rahul are at the crease. de Kock is on strike. Chahar will open the attack
Chahar to de Kock, no run, gentle inswinger on back of a length, de Kock defends off the back foot
Chahar to de Kock, no run, oh tried the outswinger very straight, didn't move much but did force de Kock to play a defensive nudge to mid-wicket
Chahar to de Kock, 1 run, the outswinger around off stump, de Kock nudges it to backward square leg
KL Rahul vs Deepak Chahar in the IPL: Runs: 134 Balls: 83 Dismissals: 0 SR: 161.44 4s/6s: 15/6
Chahar to Rahul, no run, takes a stride forward to kill some movement, KL guides this outswinging length delivery to backward point
Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, tries the inswinger from short of length, KL punches it nicely off the back foot but a diving fielder saves at least two
Chahar to de Kock, 1 run, smart of Chahar and Rutu to have a deep backward point - one of the strong zones for Quinton. Nice back foot punch though that raced off the back foot, just a single
Tushar Deshpande, right-arm medium, comes into the attack
Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, no run, puncy off-drve, decent timing but Tushar Deshpande won't mind if QdK plays that shot uppishly with some uneven bounce from the pitch
Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, FOUR, trademark QdK! Anything too close to the body with no fine leg, he just dispatches it out of his sight. Pick-up flick over backward square leg
Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, no run, short of length delivery, de Kock cuts into the wicket but bounces nicely for backward point to cut it off

Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, wide, oh pace off! Smart of Tushar Deshpande and de Kock went "ohhh" as he was early into the shot but the ump didn't like the width on that one. All that effort in vain for the bowler
Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, 1 run, fullish and outside off stump, de Kock looks to drive, toe-ends it towards cover
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, 1 run, nice punch drive to mid-on as Tushar attacks the poles with a length delivery

Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, 2 runs, in the airrrr and lands safely! Widish short of length delivery angling across, de Kock toe-ends the loft off the back foot, third man was up and deep point had too much ground to cover
So far, back of a length seems to be tough to put away
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, but not if it's that short and that straight with literally no protection at mid-wicket or deep. Sat up to be hit, KL goes back and pulls through mid-wicket for four
Chahar to Rahul, no run, oh under edge on the bounce and Dhoni does well to get a hand on it overhead to save four! Short of a length delivery moving away, KL tried to dab, got away with the mishit
Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, length delivery outside off stump, Rahul guides it to deep backward point
Chahar to de Kock, 1 run, steepler from Chahar, de Kock mistimes the pull to deep mid-wicket

Chahar to Rahul, SIX, in the airrr, mistimed but he's got enough on it! They had to make a move on because thay also have to factor in Pathirana's overs. KL took the risk of hitting the pull on the rise from short of length, but he swung hard enough to clear the long-on ropes. Calculated risk that from the captain
Chahar to Rahul, no run, nice bumper, KL sways out. This 12-run over will lift the mood in the LSG camp
Rutu was signalling someone to be ready for the next over it's Fizz
Mustafizur Rahman, left-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Mustafizur to de Kock, 1 run, soft appeal for LBW mainly from the bowler. De Kock was troubled by the outswing on this length delivery, inside edge onto pad and rolling to cover-point

Mustafizur to Rahul, FOUR, oh punched down the ground over Fizz's head. Was uppish and close to the bowler but Fizz was understandably trying to evade and then tried to go overhead because that was coming for his head. KL hit that length delivery nicely on the rise
Mustafizur to Rahul, 1 run, short of length delivery, Rahul taps it to cover-point and gets off strike
Mustafizur to de Kock, 1 run, punches is nicely with an angled bat to deep backward point
Mustafizur to Rahul, 1 run, full and slow wide of off, KL square drives to deep point
Mustafizur to de Kock, no run, again a sweet back foot punch, but Jaddu at cover-point cuts it off with a dive. Is he holding his left calf/hamstring after that stop? Walks off fine after that though
Tushar Deshpande [1.0-0-9-0] is back into the attack

Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, FOUR, another leg-side short of length delivery from Tushar Deshpande with fine leg up. KL happily rocks back and pulls over the infield and picks up four more. Was pace off but the line was wrong
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, no run, oh rushed him on the pull properly there. Short of a length, pace on, KL was late on the pull and it goes to mid-on off the splice of the bat
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, leg byes, 1 run, missed out on a gift of a full toss there! Was down leg with fine leg in too, KL missed the glance, ball hits the pad and rolls to the on-side

Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, no run, Quinton backs away to access the cover region but Tushar Deshpande cleverly takes pace off and forces a leg-side mishit that rolls to mid-on. KL immediately goes up to QdK for a chat

Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, no run, oh almost knocked the leg stump out! This is good comeback from Tushar Deshpande after that early boundary. QdK this time went leg-side to wrist it away, missed the yorker and it almost hit the stumps

Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, SIX, finally nails it! Shuffles to put the bowler off. Tushar Deshpande bowls a short of length delivery at the body and QdK is very strong with the pick-up shot and he sends this over mid-wicket
Come what may, CSK are one team that don't bowl spin much in the first 3 overs for sure irrespective of matchups. Today they aren't going to bowl any in the PP
Deepak Chahar [2.0-0-15-0] is back into the attack
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, uppish and four! Short slower delivery, KL backs away and cuts past backward point, sliced it in the gap and managed to get four

Chahar to Rahul, SIX, outstanding from KL. The bowling very predictable, short and into the wicket, so KL camps back and slaps it hard over cover for four. Tough to get power on that shot but that's Klaasy Rahul for you
Chahar to Rahul, no run, big grunt from KL as he misses out on a freebie! Short and outside off stump with third man in, wanted to guide it to the boundary but missed it
Chahar to Rahul, no run, short of length delivery, KL mistimes to cover
Chahar to Rahul, no run, short slower delivery, KL early into the pull, tries to bail out and he's very lucky that didn't go up for a simple catch. Hit the bat and rolled to the off-side
Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, short delivery, KL mistimes the pull, man at deep mid-wicket but doesn't carry. Pretty good comeback from Chahar after 4 and 6 very early

Over Summary (1-6): -- Chahar starts off on a tight note -- Rahul slams the first sixer of the essay -- Deshpande goes for 11 in his second over -- Rahul takes Chahar down and scores a four and a six in the 6th over
CSK have managed to pick just seven wickets in the powerplay this season, which is the second lowest after RCB's 4.
Ravindra Jadeja, Left arm orthodox, comes into the attack
Jadeja to Rahul, wide, Jaddu is on for his darts, but he darts down leg
Slip in place
Jadeja to Rahul, 1 run, keeps it tight on the stumps, KL pushes it through cover and gets QdK back on strike to take the bowler on
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, full and on the stumps, de Kock drives to long-on
Jadeja to Rahul, 1 run, 95.1kph on the stumps, Rahul punches off the back foot through cover-point
Jadeja to de Kock, 2 runs, smart nudge to mid-wicket to take advantage of the big leg-side boundary and they steal the second run
Jadeja to de Kock, 2 runs, there's the slog from de Kock finally to Jadeja. But it's cut off well by Rizvi. QdK went hard on that shot but couldn't place it past deep backward square leg
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, wow, just 86ks from Jadeja. That's a rarity from him. Nudged to mid-wicket and nine easily off that over
Matheesha Pathirana, right-arm fast, comes into the attack
Pathirana to de Kock, 1 run, fuller length delivery tailing in at 140.6 kph. de Kock whips the ball off the pads and sends it down to deep backward square for a single
Pathirana to Rahul, wide, length delivery, well wide, outside off, Rahul throws his bat at it and misses. Was wided. No feet from Rahul as he tried to hit that away

Pathirana to Rahul, SIX, the pace from the bowler has helped the batter. That was short at 135.4 kph and Rahul opened the face of the bat by rilling his wrists over that and sending it well over third man. Excellent use of pace from the batter
Pathirana to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length delivery, angled in, Rahul closes the face of the bat and nudges it down to fine leg for a single. 105 needed off 75 balls now
Pathirana to de Kock, 1 run, fuller length delivery, de Kock whips it down to deep backward square for a single. The bat face twisted on impact
Pathirana to Rahul, 1 run, good bumper at the body. The batter pulls it down to deep backward square for a single. Was sent down at 140 clicks by Pathirana
Pathirana to de Kock, 1 run, fuller length delivery angled in 138.7 kph. The batter on-drove it wide of mid-on for a single. Came off the inner half of the bat again. 102 needed now
Jadeja to de Kock, FOUR, straight down the ground for a four. Backs away and lofts it down the ground. The man at long-off was very square. Lovely shot

Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, Pathirana drops it at short third man Was circling under it. Picked it late and then tried to grab it with hard hands but dropped it in the end. Was a flighted one, de Kock backed away and looked to flog it. Got a leading edge and the fielder made a mess of it
Jadeja to Rahul, 1 run, backs away and stabs it down to deep cover for a single
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, nudges it behind square for a single

Jadeja to Rahul, 1 run, big appeal from Jadeja as Rahul missed the sweep. But MS I guess picked the inside edge on it and hence didn't go up. He was hit outside the line of the sticks as well I reckon. The ball dribbled down into the off-side
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, flatter one, at the sticks, de Kock pulls it down in a hurried manner to long-on

22:13 Local Time, 16:43 GMT, 22:13 IST: Time-out. LSG bossing the chase so far. They had their slice of luck as well. QDK has looked a little scratchy Rahul though has been aggressive. They have scored at more than 9 per over. Only 93 needed now off 11 overs. CSK now need a barrage of wickets and some luck as well to turn this around. And LSG just need to keep going and this should be an easy walk in the park barring the slippery icing.
Moeen Ali, right-arm off break, comes into the attack
Moeen Ali to de Kock, 1 run, tossed up delivery, de Kock nudges the ball down on to the on-side for a single. Played it late
Moeen Ali to Rahul, 2 runs, drops it short at 94.6 kph. Rahul stabs the cut down and the mistimed shot earns him a brace. The man at sweeper cover cut it off
Moeen Ali to Rahul, 1 run, tucks it off the pads to deep backward square for a single as the ball turned in
Moeen Ali to de Kock, no run, tossed up delivery, lovely loop at 87.5 clicks. de Kock jabs at it and gets beaten outside off
Moeen Ali to de Kock, 1 run, 92.2 clicks, outside off, turning away, de Kock backs away and slaps it wide of cover for a single to long-off
Moeen Ali to Rahul, no run, flatter one, at the sticks, at 88 clicks, Rahul pats it back to the bowler. Tried to close the face of the bat but was early into the shot
Jadeja to de Kock, no run, flatter one, at the pads, de Kock looks to heave it away but misses. Was fired in at 96 clicks at the pads
Jadeja to de Kock, FOUR, gets inside the line of the delivery by swivelling on to the back pad. Picked the short ball and hammered it behind square for a four. Lovely placement from QDK
Jadeja to de Kock, 1 run, too full, nudged down on to the on-side, single added

Jadeja to Rahul, FOUR, backs away and slaps the cut past point. Lovely shot indeed. Fifty for the LSG skipper. Created the room and pounced on the short ball from Jadeja. The man at point failed to stop it

Jadeja to Rahul, FOUR, 100 up for LSG! Was hit uppishly. More of the outer-half of the bat and the ball sliced away between short third and point. The man at short third - Fizz - gave it a poor chase. He could have dived but decided against it. The ball teased him to the fence. Rahul wasn't in control of the shot but managed to find the gap
Jadeja to Rahul, 1 run, stabbed wide of the man at point for a single as that was a flatter one outside off. This is the highest partnership for any wicket at this venue
Mustafizur Rahman [1.0-0-8-0] is back into the attack
Mustafizur to Rahul, no run, fuller length delivery, little slower, Rahul checks his drive and finds the man at cover
Mustafizur to Rahul, no run, short ball at 133.4 kph. Rahul looked a little cramped as he tried to pull it. Got an inside edge and the ball dribbled back into the deck
Mustafizur to Rahul, 1 run, slower short ball on to the left shoulder. Rahul pulls it down to long leg for a single. Has been a quiet over from Mustafizur so far
Mustafizur to de Kock, 1 run, back of a length delivery at 128 clicks. de Kock nudges the ball down on to the on-side for a single
Mustafizur to Rahul, FOUR, short ball at 130.1 clicks. Rahul kept it down and managed to send it wide of the man at long leg. That didn't scale much height and Rahul had time to place it into the gap
Mustafizur to Rahul, 1 run, stays back and stabs it down into the off-side for a single as the ball angled across

Over Summary (7-12): -- Jadeja brought on but LSG milk him for 9 -- Early intro of Pathirana doesn't work as he gives away 12 runs -- Pathirana drops a tough chance off QdK on 31 -- Moeen comes on for a tight over -- Jadeja leaks 14 off his third over as LSG march ahead
Matheesha Pathirana [1.0-0-12-0] is back into the attack
Pathirana to Rahul, no run, short, wide, at 135.3 clicks. Rahul cue-ends it down to cover. Wanted to slap it but failed to time it
Pathirana to Rahul, no run, back of a length delivery, tucked down to mid-wicket as that came in to the batter at 134.3 clicks
Pathirana to Rahul, 1 run, fuller length delivery at 133.2 kph. Rahul looks to flay that through the off-side and gets an inside edge into the on-side for a single. Wanted to hit it hard
Pathirana to de Kock, no run, length delivery angled across at 136.7 kph. de Kock looks to flog it across the line and misses as the ball skidded through to the keeper
Pathirana to de Kock, wide, banged in short, too short, the batter looks to pull and misses. Has been wided
QDK having an issue with a spider cam positioned at square leg region. He points the same out to the umpire Anil Kumar Chaudhary.
Pathirana to de Kock, 1 run, banged in short, outside off, pulled down to long-on for a single
Pathirana to Rahul, no run, fuller one, at 136.3 kph. Rahul drives on the up but fails to beat the man at cover. Excellent over from Pathirana as he gave away only three runs off that.
Tushar Deshpande [2.0-0-19-0] is back into the attack
Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, 1 run, starts a new spell with a widish length delivery. Stabbed out for a single
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, 1 run, banged in short at the body, Rahul pulls the ball down to deep mid for a single
Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, wide, wided! The batter wanted to heave it away but failed to as the bowler missed the radar. 61 needed now
Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, no run, fuller length delivery, well outside off, de Kock looked to drive and missed it
Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, FOUR, slower one at 121.9 clicks. de Kock waits on it and reverse scoops it fine. The man at third man was inside the circle and he had no chance. QDK moves to 48
Tushar Deshpande to de Kock, 1 run, length delivery, outside off, stabbed shot to deep cover for a single. 56 needed now off 37 balls
Tushar Deshpande to Rahul, no run, decent over from Tushar Deshpande as he finishes the over with a yorker. Right up there and Rahul jammed it out on to the on-side
Mustafizur Rahman [2.0-0-15-0] is back into the attack
Mustafizur to de Kock, wide, slower one, down leg, de Kock misses the heave. Was bowled at 112.6 kph. 55 needed off 36 balls

Mustafizur to de Kock, 1 run, short ball, angled in at the body. Pulled down to deep mid for a single. Fifty for QDK. He has taken his time but those timely fours have helped LSG so far. Needs to finish this off now
Mustafizur to Rahul, 2 runs, sits down and slams the highish full toss wide of deep mid for a brace. That wasn't timed well by Rahul. 52 needed off 34 balls now
Mustafizur to Rahul, FOUR, that's serene from Rahul! Pure timing. Fuller, slower, outside off, Rahul square drives it wide of third man for a four. They are doing it easy
Mustafizur to Rahul, 1 run, fuller length delivery, wide outside off, Rahul slashes it down to deep cover for a single. 47 needed off 32 balls now
Mustafizur to de Kock, FOUR, lovely timing and placement. Slower one at 115.7 clicks. de Kock backs away and slices the ball down past point. The man at deep cover had no chance to his left
Mustafizur to de Kock, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Mustafizur to de Kock, out Caught by Dhoni!! Dhoni had a sheepish smile. Waited for QDK to walk I reckon. Was a short ball, angled in, de Kock backed away and looked to steer it. But got a faint edge and Dhoni bent low a little to take it easily. There was hardly an appeal but QDK decided to walk. CSK have their first wicket. A little too late but they would still take it. A decent knock from QDK has come to an end. The tinge of extra bounce did the batter in. de Kock c Dhoni b Mustafizur 54(43) [4s-5 6s-1]
Pooran as expected has come in. 43 needed off 5 overs. LSG have plenty of wickets in hand.
Nicholas Pooran, left handed bat, comes to the crease
Matheesha Pathirana [2.0-0-15-0] is back into the attack
Pathirana to Rahul, 1 run, blazes a length delivery down to deep cover for a single as he got the room outside off

Pathirana to Pooran, 1 run, fuller length delivery at 149.7 kph. Pooran got his feet out of harm's way and drove it down to mid-off. The fielder put in the slide and a little fumble happened as well. They get a single

Pathirana to Rahul, 1 run, Rahul was gone for all money! CSK's fielding hasn't been the greatest today. Ruturaj hurled the throw but missed the sticks at the bowler's end. That came off the inner half of the bat and Rahul decided to run
Pathirana to Pooran, SIX, gets under it and slams it over long-on! That was fuller, outside off, Pooran got under it and slammed it hugeeee
Pathirana to Pooran, 1 run, good stop by Deshpande at mid-wicket. Fuller one, angled in, Pooran clipped it but failed to beat the dive at mid-wicket from Deshpande
Pathirana to Rahul, 2 runs, fuller length delivery, well outside off, Rahul drilled it hard. The man at sweeper cover - Dube - put in a clumsy dive and stopped it. Only a couple now. I0$
Over Summary (13-16): -- Pathirana bowls a 3-run over -- Fizz concedes 13 but gets QdK after he gets his fifty -- Pathirana taken for 12 runs

22:51 Local Time, 17:21 GMT, 22:51 IST: Time-out again. LSG have yawned their way to 146. Not many challenges have been thrown at them. Yes, QDK did get a chance but barring that they haven't put a foot wrong. Pooran has been promoted to kill off the chase and he has started on the right not as well. CSK would feel they need at least 20 more to threaten LSG in their backyard. They have got that boundary whenever they have desired one and that too without taking many risks.

Mustafizur to Pooran, FOUR, he has been seeing it like a beach ball all through this tourney. Very full, at 133.3 clicks, not much wrong with the ball but the batter opened the face of the bat and got it wide of the man at point
Mustafizur to Pooran, wide, looks to slash a slower ball well outside off and misses. The pace wasn't there on it and Pooran wanted to hit it hard
Mustafizur to Pooran, FOUR, easy pickings for Pooran. Fuller one, on the pads, at 133.9 clicks. Pooran clips it wide of short fine for a four. He is placing them and timing them like a dream
Mustafizur to Pooran, no run, slower one, cuts in off the deck at 115.4 kph. Pooran looks to slap it and misses
Mustafizur to Pooran, 1 run, good short ball, at 124.7 kph. Pooran mistimes the pull and lands short of the man at deep mid. Only a single. 21 needed now

Mustafizur to Rahul, FOUR, lovely timing! Superb placement as well. Rizvi and Ravindra left it for each other and none dived. Fuller ball, outside off, Rahul opened the face of the bat and placed it beautifully. The fielders tried to converge on the ball but left it for each other in the end
Mustafizur to Rahul, 1 run, cue-ends the ball down to deep point for a single as that was a slower one outside off. 16 needed now off 18 balls
Pathirana to Rahul, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Pathirana to Rahul, out Caught by Jadeja!! That would have stung Jadeja like a bee! But Jadeja had plucked a blinder. Short, wide, slapped hard and the man at point picked it up with his left hand. Ruturaj couldn't believe it neither could the batter. Excellent take. Jadeja took it clean. But did he manage to hold on to it after he fell to the ground is what the third umpire is checking. One of the angles comes up with a blind spot. The third umpire feels Jadeja got his fingers under the ball and that he had no reasons to overturn the original call. One of the best catches of this IPL season and it had to take a blinder to remove Rahul tonight. Not a great ball from Pathirana but he gets his first wicket. The batter smashed it with all his might but Jadeja like a wall absorbed it all. Only with his left hand! Rahul c Jadeja b Pathirana 82(53) [4s-9 6s-3]
Marcus Stoinis, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Pathirana to Stoinis, no run, fuller length delivery, Stoinis gets the bat down and defends it down to mid-wicket
Pathirana to Stoinis, leg byes, 2 runs, fuller length delivery, on the pads, Stoinis looks to clip it and misses. The ball went fine and off the pads. The Fizz at fine leg managed to cut it off
Pathirana to Stoinis, 1 run, fuller length delivery, well outside off, squeezed wide of point for a single. 13 needed off 14 balls now

Pathirana to Pooran, no run, fuller length delivery, slanted in, Pooran looks to clip it and misses. Ruturaj decides for a late review. Pathirana had appealled but it seemed like going down. No bat on it but was going well down leg and it also landed outside leg. Easy call for the third umpire to make. CSK chanced their arm and lost the review. 13 needed now off 13 balls
Pathirana to Pooran, 1 run, walks across and clips the fuller ball down to deep mid. Keeps the strike and 12 needed now. LSG should target to finish it off in the next over itself
Five fielders inside the circle now. The overrate hasn't been great.
Tushar Deshpande [3.0-0-27-0] is back into the attack
Tushar Deshpande to Pooran, 1 run, very full, on-driven down to long-on for a single. 11 needed now off 11
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, FOUR, despairing dive from Rizvi at deep cover but he fails to stop it. Was a fuller ball, outside off, Stoinis drilled it wide of the deep cover fielder. Only 7 now
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, wide, fails to nail the wide yorker from round the wicket. The batter tried to jam it but missed. Wided
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, wide, very full, very wide, Stoinis misses it and wided again. Deshpande sticking to his plan but execution has been poor
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, no run, length delivery, angled across, Stoinis looked to slog it and gets an inside edge down to the keeper
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, 2 runs, low full toss, outside off, Stoinis sliced it down to deep third man for a couple of runs. The throw came in at the bowler's end. But easy two scored
Tushar Deshpande to Stoinis, 1 run, tucks a length delivery down to deep mid for a single. 2 needed now. Nicky P has the chance

Tushar Deshpande to Pooran, no ball, free-hit coming up! The scores are level. Was a highish full toss, slanted across, Pooran wanted to open the face of the bat but missed it. CSK have reviewed it. Despite Pooran bending down, it was still close to being head high. CSK taking their chance. The height on the ball was 1.23m and the waist height for Pooran is 0.99m. So, it was a no-ball

Tushar Deshpande to Pooran, FOUR, sliced over point. LSG win! They win with an over and 8 wickets to spare. They have thumped the visitors here. Was short, Pooran backed away and managed to get it over point

23:18 Local Time, 17:48 GMT, 23:18 IST: LSG haven't lost much sweat in chasing this down. Did it get easier to bat second? It did. But CSK bowling and fielding was a lot to be desired. They sprayed it to all parts of the deck. Didn't use Ali enough and Jadeja the bowler was put under pressure. Mustafizur struggled for control and so did Pathirana. But all of this because Rahul batted like a dream. The wicket was a little two-paced. QDK found it a little tough and got a chance as well. But he hung in there and together with Rahul added 134 for the first wicket. That killed off the chase. Earlier, LSG controlled the CSK batting as well to restrict them to 176. LSG picked up wickets with the new ball and in the middle overs and it was MSD who scored a brisk cameo to take them close to 180. In hindsight, CSK would feel that they were at least 20 short as LSG barely tried too hard to chase this down.

Successful run-chases for LSG in the IPL (by targets) 213 vs RCB - by 1 wicket - Bengaluru, 2023 211 vs CSK - by 6 wickets - Brabourne, 2022 183 vs SRH - by 7 wickets - Hyderabad, 2023 177 vs CSK - by 8 wickets - Lucknow, 2024 150 vs DC - by 6 wickets - Mumbai DYP, 2022 122 vs SRH - by 6 wickets - Lucknow, 2023 I0$

Highest partnerships for LSG (any wicket) 210* - KL Rahul & Quinton de Kock vs KKR, Mumbai DYP, 2022 134 - KL Rahul & Quinton de Kock vs CSK, Lucknow, 2024 99 - KL Rahul & Quinton de Kock vs CSK, Brabourne, 2022 96 - KL Rahul & Deepak Hooda vs RCB, Kolkata, 2022 95 - KL Rahul & Deepak Hooda vs DC, Mumbai WS, 2022

Highest opening partnerships vs CSK in the IPL 144 - Ajinkya Rahane & Shane Watson (RR), Ahmedabad, 2015 138 - Shikhar Dhawan & Prithvi Shaw (DC), Mumbai WS, 2021 134 - KL Rahul & Quinton de Kock (LSG), Lucknow, 2024 127 - Graeme Smith & Swapnil Asnodkar (RR), Chennai, 2008 116* - Quinton de Kock & Ishan Kishan (MI), Sharjah, 2020 116 - David Warner & Shikhar Dhawan (SRH), Ranchi, 2014

Opening stands vs CSK in IPL 2024 41(4.3 overs) - RCB, Chennai 28 (2.5 overs) - GT, Chennai 93(9.3 overs) - DC, Visakhapatnam 46 (2.4 overs) - SRH, Hyderabad 0 (0.1 overs) - KKR, Chennai 70 (7.1 overs) - MI, Mumbai 134 (15 overs) - LSG, Lucknow Total: 412 runs (Average: 58.85, RR: 9.84) Opening partnerships have collectively averaged 58.85 vs CSK this season, which is the most against a team, followed by 57.57 vs RCB.
Most 50-plus scores as a designated wicketkeeper (IPL) 25 - KL Rahul 24 - MS Dhoni 23 - Quinton de Kock 21 - Dinesh Karthik 18 - Robin Uthappa
KL Rahul in run-chases vs CSK Innings: 7 Runs: 371 Avg: 61.83 SR: 161.3 50s: 4 HS: 98*
Successful run-chases in Lucknow in the IPL (by targets) 177 - LSG vs CSK, 2024 168 - DC vs LSG, 2024 160 - PBKS vs LSG, 2023 122 - LSG vs SRH, 2023
Stats by Roshan Gede

Ruturaj Gaikwad: We finished well with the bat, couldn't have asked more with the situation we were in. After powerplay we couldn't capitalize on the start we got and we kept losing wickets at regular intervals. I would say we were 10-15 runs short. Slightly difficult with such a total, with the impact sub rule you need 10-15 or even 20 runs extra. Pitches like these seem sluggish to start off with but with dew coming on it gets better, 190 would have been a good score. One area we would like to improve in taking wickets in the powerplay. That will put pressure on the opposition. We need to work on it. Good to play them again (next game at Chepauk). We will come up with good homework done now that we have three home games.

Marcus Stoinis: We did need that, it was an very important win for us. We've got these guys - Chennai - in a couple of days' time, it's important two games for us, it's nice to be back on the winning board. We are playing good cricket. With how we started with the ball and taking early wickets, I think we could have kept them under that total. Hats off to the way they played and they finished obviously with MS. They played well towards the end but it's a nice wicket and we built some partnerships. Quinny (de Kock) and KL batted beautifully to pretty much seal it and then Nicky (Pooran) came in and iced the cake. That's an important partnership for us at the top. Having that continuity, having them get us off to a start allows us to play the rest of the innings and to build an order around it as well. We've got that confidence with our team and the nice thing about this season so far is there's been different boys stepping up and chipping in to win these games at different stages. We've had our bowling attack bowl well, we've had our batters bat well, had our opening partnership tonight. Different people are putting their hand up which I think is a great sign for the team. I said to KL I0$ I wanna bowl, if you can get into the captain's ear and just push that, it'll be great.

KL Rahul, skipper of LSG and Player of the Match: Feels good at the end of the day. When you win, most decisions feel right. We were committed to our plans. Really happy with that. Depends on the wicket, I deploy my bowlers. We tried to mix it around. The bowlers executed really well. The team is sticking to the plans. Halfway stage, I would have been happy with 160. The wicket was slow and a bit of grip. MSD walked in and the pressure got to the bowlers. He has had the intimidation on opposition bowlers. Our young bowlers were put under pressure with the crowd going berserk as well. 15-20 runs extra they got. I have been trying to assess the situation. It came off today. I knew the CSK spinners will put the pressure on. I picked my bowlers and it came off. Quinton batted well as well. Made life easy for both. Different ball game playing in Chennai. Was playing in front of mini Chennai crowd. We are a young team and happy to play in front of such a crowd.

LSG needed a win and they have got one. Big one actually. They had lost two on the bounce. Their next assignment after this was at Chepauk. They needed a win at any cost and they have pocketed it easily. They were geared up for a big tussle but CSK batters just couldn't arrive today. Jadeja and MSD towards the end ensured it was close to 180. Else for a major part of the first innings, CSK were behind the 8-ball. Then QDK and Rahul just came up with a clinical response. Two points have allowed LSG to occupy the fifth position on the table. Their NRR is in positive as well. A herd of four teams were looking to breakaway but LSG wants to be part of the traffic. CSK would feel a little disappointed as they came into this game having defended a score at Wankhede. But three home games from now is just the tonic that the team in yellow won't complain of. We aren't complaining either as we move rapidly towards the half stage in the tourney. Teams are closely packed to each other. And we will continue dishing out every detail. This is our team of MS Ramakrishnan, Abhinand Raghavendran, Siva and Kumar Abhisekh Das signing off.
